pr_title: Inline SQL functions at plan time

timeline.message: [WIP] Inline SQL functions at plan time

timeline.bodyText: No need to have else here.
timeline.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: I think we normally would just put the rewriter as a private class for the rule itself so you can move this to InlineSqlFunctions.java, unless you expect this to be used by other classes.
timeline.author: rongrong
rongrong

timeline.bodyText: You don't have to call setSupportedFunctionLanguages here, the default (SQL only) should work. But if you want to add THRIFT function, might as well add a test to make sure that won't be inlined. 😂  You can also add tests to make sure builtin SQL functions like array_sum is also inlined correctly if you want.
timeline.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: Should we do this at CREATE FUNCTION execution time?

replies.bodyText: Yes, that's a good idea, done.

timeline.message: Fix improperly scoped argument binding in lambda expressions
Coerce SQL function expressions at create time
Coerce SQL function expressions at create time

timeline.bodyText: Let's keep this. We need to check all existing functions and update them before it's safe to remove these. So also add the coercion in getSqlFunctionExpression. We can think about introducing a warning for this and deprecate this in later releases.
timeline.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: Nits: I found it more logical to have this before the return cast rather than after, but I don't have strong opinions.
